title: Director / VP Sales
description:
Linqia is the leader in the growing creator marketing industry. We partner with the world's largest brands, including Danone, AB InBev, Kimberly-Clark, Unilever, and Walmart, to build compelling and effective influencer marketing campaigns. Our AI-driven platform and team of experts are leading the transformation of influencer marketing.

We value intelligence, recognize talent, and have instilled a culture that supports our career development and personal growth. We thrive on innovation and accountability, with a customer-first attitude that adds actual value to everything we touch. Our team members are intelligent, hard-working, and have integrity. They love to have fun as we play to win. At Linqia, you'll be working with others who are passionate about marketing in a fun, fast-paced, and data-driven environment.

**Role:**

The Director / VP Sales will be responsible for executing a consultative sale to Fortune 1000 brand, shopper, and media agency teams. The ideal candidate is a creator marketing and influencer expert (strong digital, social background), be a hunter, solution based seller and results oriented. You should have established client relationships in the CPG, QSR, finance, or healthcare / pharma verticals. You will own the entire sales cycle and be responsible for prospecting, understanding the customer's needs and presenting solutions as a trusted partner.

**Responsibilities:**

* Work directly with Fortune 1000 Companies and / or their agency partners to educate them on the merits of creator marketing and the value of creator content
* Apply a consultative sales approach that focuses on client objectives, but also maintain a sense of urgency on closing deals
* Have the ability to convey our solution with passion with a focus on the value of targeted, trend forward , creator generated content at scale
* Understand the value of data driven media solutions and be able to leverage insights and analytics to penetrate clients and close deals
* Develop strategic client relationships through large ($1M+) annual and multi-year contractual commitments
* Drive open opportunities to close in quarter with an eye towards building a strong pipeline for subsequent quarters
* Build a book of business from the ground-up, mentor team members, and prepare for additional leadership as we scale
* Help develop and refine our in-market partner approach by becoming a lead story teller and educate our clients on our platform's best practices
* Apply creativity, demonstrate accountability and maintain a deep understanding of Linqia's services and business model
* Work in a highly dynamic environment with a proven ability to balance competing demands and priorities as well as operate independently
* Proactively manage a rapidly growing sales pipeline/channel
* Be comfortable with carrying a Sales quota, be accountable for delivering revenue, and expect to be handsomely rewarded for over achieving
* Travel required

**Qualifications:**

* +7 years of proven success selling in digital sales and/or online media to executive-level brand clients / agency partners
* Established and transferable relationships in CPG, restaurant, apparel or entertainment verticals
* Proven track record of consistent quota achievement above goal - we're looking for all-stars!
* Demonstrable experience closing committed deals in excess of $1M annually
* Strong consultative sales skills, collaborative + flexible workstyle, while maintaining your competitive drive to win
* A passion for, and evidence of successfully developing creative ideas for clients through leveraging data to deliver optimal client value
* Deep knowledge of promoted and organic best practices on all major social media platforms
* Experience navigating, communicating and leading in a cross-functional environment
Deep understanding of the advertising industry* -including client-direct and key agency relationships
* Excellent presentation/pitch, public speaking, problem solving and negotiating skills
* Bachelor's degree required, MBA a plus
* Can have fun while working hard!

  

*Note - This role is working remotely, but must be based in the Chicago metro area.*

  

This position description is intended to describe the duties most frequently performed by an individual in this position. Linqia is an equal opportunity employer supporting workforce diversity. We actively encourage women, people with disabilities, veterans, underrepresented minorities, and LGBTQ+ people to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes or candidates through this Web site or directly to employees. Linqia does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with us.

title: Director / VP Sales
description:
Linqia is the leader in the growing creator marketing industry. We partner with the world's largest brands, including Danone, AB InBev, Kimberly-Clark, Unilever, and Walmart, to build compelling and effective influencer marketing campaigns. Our AI-driven platform and team of experts are leading the transformation of influencer marketing.

We value intelligence, recognize talent, and have instilled a culture that supports our career development and personal growth. We thrive on innovation and accountability, with a customer-first attitude that adds actual value to everything we touch. Our team members are intelligent, hard-working, and have integrity. They love to have fun as we play to win. At Linqia, you'll be working with others who are passionate about marketing in a fun, fast-paced, and data-driven environment.

**Role:**

The Director / VP Sales will be responsible for executing a consultative sale to Fortune 1000 brand, shopper, and media agency teams. The ideal candidate is a creator marketing and influencer expert (strong digital, social background), be a hunter, solution based seller and results oriented. You should have established client relationships in the CPG, QSR, finance, or healthcare / pharma verticals. You will own the entire sales cycle and be responsible for prospecting, understanding the customer's needs and presenting solutions as a trusted partner.

**Responsibilities:**

* Work directly with Fortune 1000 Companies and / or their agency partners to educate them on the merits of creator marketing and the value of creator content
* Apply a consultative sales approach that focuses on client objectives, but also maintain a sense of urgency on closing deals
* Have the ability to convey our solution with passion with a focus on the value of targeted, trend forward , creator generated content at scale
* Understand the value of data driven media solutions and be able to leverage insights and analytics to penetrate clients and close deals
* Develop strategic client relationships through large ($1M+) annual and multi-year contractual commitments
* Drive open opportunities to close in quarter with an eye towards building a strong pipeline for subsequent quarters
* Build a book of business from the ground-up, mentor team members, and prepare for additional leadership as we scale
* Help develop and refine our in-market partner approach by becoming a lead story teller and educate our clients on our platform's best practices
* Apply creativity, demonstrate accountability and maintain a deep understanding of Linqia's services and business model
* Work in a highly dynamic environment with a proven ability to balance competing demands and priorities as well as operate independently
* Proactively manage a rapidly growing sales pipeline/channel
* Be comfortable with carrying a Sales quota, be accountable for delivering revenue, and expect to be handsomely rewarded for over achieving
* Travel required

**Qualifications:**

* +7 years of proven success selling in digital sales and/or online media to executive-level brand clients / agency partners
* Established and transferable relationships in CPG, restaurant, apparel or entertainment verticals
* Proven track record of consistent quota achievement above goal - we're looking for all-stars!
* Demonstrable experience closing committed deals in excess of $1M annually
* Strong consultative sales skills, collaborative + flexible workstyle, while maintaining your competitive drive to win
* A passion for, and evidence of successfully developing creative ideas for clients through leveraging data to deliver optimal client value
* Deep knowledge of promoted and organic best practices on all major social media platforms
* Experience navigating, communicating and leading in a cross-functional environment
Deep understanding of the advertising industry* -including client-direct and key agency relationships
* Excellent presentation/pitch, public speaking, problem solving and negotiating skills
* Bachelor's degree required, MBA a plus
* Can have fun while working hard!
* Must currently reside in the San Francisco Bay Area and be available to commute to the San Francisco office 3 times per week.

  

This position description is intended to describe the duties most frequently performed by an individual in this position. Linqia is an equal opportunity employer supporting workforce diversity. We actively encourage women, people with disabilities, veterans, underrepresented minorities, and LGBTQ+ people to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes or candidates through this Web site or directly to employees. Linqia does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with us.

title: Vice President of Sales (Southeast Region)
description:
**At Veritext, we focus on the details – so legal teams can focus on the case.**

**About the role:**

Providing our clients with exceptional service is the foundation of our business. The **Vice President of Sales** is an important part of the organization at Veritext and will be responsible for providing essential support to clients throughout the region and, in addition to providing strategy and direction for the Director of Sales and the Account Executives within the region. This leader collaborates with the RVP and the Director/VP of Operations, to ensure attainment of all operation business objective, all client objectives and adherence to Service Level Agreements.

**What you'll get to do:**

* Maintain relationships and grow top-tier clients in the region
* Collaborate with the other field leaders to collaborate and grow the business in the individual markets
* Develop a business plan and sales strategy for the markets to ensures the attainment of company sales goals and profitability
* Responsible for the performance and development of the Director of Sales and Account Executives.
* Prepares action plans by individuals as well as by the team for effective search of sales leads and prospects
* Initiates and coordinates the development of action plans to penetrate new markets
* Assists in the development and implementation of marketing plans as needed
* Conducts one-on-one review with all Directors of Sales to build more effective communications, understand training and development needs, and provide insight for the improvement of the Account Executive’s sales and activity performance
* Provides timely feedback to senior management regarding performance
* Provides timely, accurate, competitive pricing on all completed prospect applications submitted for pricing and approval, while striving to maintain maximum profit margin
* Maintains accurate records of all pricings, sales, and activity reports submitted by Account Executives
* Creates and conducts proposal presentations and RFP responses
* Assists teams in preparation of proposals and presentations.
* Controls expenses to meet budget guidelines
* Adheres to all company policies, procedures, and business ethics codes and ensures that they are communicated and implemented within the team
* Takes part in Interviews when hiring Account Executives based on criteria agreed upon by senior management
* Sales Support functions such as ordering client giveaways, and event planning.
* Client and witness accommodations (setting up conference rooms for depositions, meetings, etc.)
* Provide support to for sales and marketing efforts, including coordination of Trade Shows, catering, networking events, and sponsorships; ensure a ready supply of marketing collateral and promotional items
* Maintains continuity among work teams by documenting and communicating actions, irregularities, and continuing needs
* Assisting the Head of Sales in the development of contests, projects, and other activities that help drive the sales process
* Administration of systems that support the sales process (Salesforce.com, Vision, etc.)
* Other duties as assigned

**The kind of leader we are looking for:**

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
* 5+ years of sales leadership experience
* Proven track record of success in a business-to-business sales environment
* Prior experience selling and leading sales within the legal industry preferred
* Proficient in the use of technology and software programs
* Excellent verbal and written communication
* Customer service oriented with strong interpersonal skills; able to respond promptly to client needs, follow through and resolve issues in a pleasant and helpful manner
* Detail oriented, organized and dedicated professional
* Proactive and motivated with good problem-solving skills
* Must be detail-oriented and accurate, ability to work well under pressure
* Excellent interpersonal skills, ability to communicate and interact effectively
* Results Driven, Professionalism, Integrity, and Accountability

**What's in it for you:**

  

* Competitive compensation: base salary + bonus opportunity and total rewards package
* Comprehensive medical, dental and vision insurance
* Paid Time Off to rest, relax and pursue special interests outside of work (8 paid holidays, 3 personal days, vacation, sick and discretionary time)
* Robust suite of mental health benefits with little to no fee for you (and your household members) to support overall mental wellbeing and provide sufficient access to high quality support from board-certified psychiatrists and licensed psychologists/therapists (app based, virtual counseling, daily emails, live and on-demand content, and more)
* Matched 401(k) to help you save for your future
* Pet insurance to help your pet(s) live a long and happy life
* Flexible Spending Accounts (healthcare, dependent care, transit & parking)
* Company-paid life insurance as well as short-term and long-term disability insurance
* Learning and development opportunities to advance both personally and professionally
* Veritext Summer Camp – a fun-filled culture building and learning experience
* Generous employee referral program, tuition reimbursement program, employee contests, social opportunities and more!

**About Veritext:**

Veritext is the global leader in technology-enabled court reporting services and litigation support solutions with a proven track record of industry excellence. For law firms, government agencies and enterprise corporations, we provide access to innovative technologies and remote solutions, the highest-quality network of reporters and legal videographers, unmatched expertise in multiparty and complex litigation, unparalleled client service, and state-of-the-art conference spaces across North America.

Veritext is committed to delivering comprehensive, client-focused legal solutions that address the evolving needs of the legal industry. Our solutions utilize the latest easy-to-use technologies to streamline the deposition process and reliably handle the most complex cases. All of this combined with unsurpassed data security ensures that Veritext clients have the best tools available and the confidence of working with the market leader.

Veritext aspires to create a community based on collaboration, innovation, creativity and belonging. Our collective success depends on the robust exchange of ideas – an exchange that is best when the rich diversity of our perspectives, backgrounds and experiences flourish. To achieve this exchange, it is essential that all individuals and stakeholders feel and experience an environment where they are welcome, safe, secure, and heard. As such, we do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, age, gender identity or expression, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status or any other classification protected by Federal, state, or local law. Any information provided will be used only in the compilation of data for EEO/Affirmative Action reporting. Completion of this data is voluntary and will not affect your opportunity for employment and/or terms or conditions of employment.

**About this posting:**

Compensation ranges, when noted, represent the expected base pay compensation range for this role. Ultimately, a number of factors including, but not limited to, your prior job-related knowledge and experience, geographic location, and qualifications will be considered when determining your pay and we may pay more or less than the posted range.

Veritext participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.

title: Inside Mortgage Sales Vice President
description:
Description:

**About Us:**

We are a federally chartered bank, offering a wide range of products across all 50 states. Our consumer direct model provides a vast lead plan, eliminating the need for self-generation of business. With our 50-state licensing footprint, you can connect with customers nationwide. Our remote business model allows you to do all of this from the comfort of your home office, offering a massive opportunity for great work-life balance.

**Position Overview:**

We are seeking a results-driven top producing Vice President of Sales to join our team. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in mortgage, banking, and leadership. This is an exciting opportunity for a top producer or a mid-level manager ready to advance their career in a thriving and supportive environment.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Drive sales growth and achieve financial goals.
* Build and develop a high-performing sales team.
* Leverage entrepreneurial skills to identify and capitalize on new business opportunities.
* Maintain a relentless focus on success and productivity.
* Collaborate across departments to enhance overall business performance.

Requirements:

* Minimum of 5 years of experience in mortgage or banking.
* Proven leadership experience with a track record of success.
* Currently a top producer or an ambitious manager seeking growth.
* Entrepreneurial mindset and aggressive in achieving goals.
* Exceptional focus on financial targets and team development.

**What We Offer:**

* Extremely competitive compensation plan.
* Comprehensive recruiting support to grow your team.
* Licensing capabilities in all 50 states.
* Opportunities to onboard both experienced and new bankers.
* Abundant leads with no need for self-generation.

If you are driven, aggressive, and ready to make significant career advancements in the mortgage industry, we invite you to apply.

**How to Apply:**

Please use the link to apply and include your resume and a brief cover letter explaining your interest and experience. We can’t wait to see how you’ll shape the future of mortgage banking with us!

Join us in shaping the future of the mortgage industry!

*The Federal Savings Bank is an* *equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.*
company_addresses:
4120 W Diversey Ave, Ste C501

title: VP Weath Management Sales
description:
VP, Wealth Management / FinTech Sales | Full-Time | Remote

**WHO WE ARE**

Headquartered in Nashville, Tenn., Ncontracts leads the industry in integrated risk management and compliance solutions, serving over 5,000 financial institutions nationwide. As a seven-time Inc. 5000 Fastest Growing Companies honoree and consistent year-over-year recipient of "Best Places to Work" awards, we offer a thriving, work environment where career growth and life-work balance go hand in hand.

At Ncontracts, you'll join a team of industry experts dedicated to strengthening the financial services sector through innovation and thought leadership. We're seeking creative, collaborative, and self-driven professionals across all areas of our business - from developing cutting-edge solutions to sales, marketing, customer support, and beyond. Join us in our mission to make the financial industry stronger and more resilient, while advancing your career in a supportive, dynamic environment that values your unique skills and perspectives.

**The Opportunity**

We're looking for a proven sales leader who can build something special. As VP of Sales for Wealth Management and FinTech , you'll have the rare opportunity to establish and scale our go-to-market strategy in two of financial services' fastest-growing sectors—wealth management and fin.

This isn't about managing the status quo. This is about building/rebuilding from the ground up: recruiting and developing a high-performing team, partnering closely with marketing and alliances to unlock channel opportunities, and rolling up your sleeves to help close deals while establishing the playbook for sustainable growth.

If you thrive on uncovering/identifying new opportunities, breaking into emerging markets, tackling complex client challenges, and driving both strategy and execution, this role is for you

**About Ncontracts**

Ncontracts is the leading integrated risk management platform serving financial institutions, with over 5,000 clients. Our suite of compliance, vendor management, and risk solutions helps community banks, credit unions, and financial services firms navigate an increasingly complex regulatory landscape.

As we expand deeper into wealth management and RIA, we're bringing our proven platform and domain expertise to a sector hungry for modern, integrated solutions that reduce risk and operational complexity.

**The Role**

As VP of Sales – Wealth Management & FinTech, you'll own the leadership and execution for this critical vertical. You'll be responsible for build upon the team in place, defining our sales approach, and driving revenue growth by establishing Ncontracts as the go-to risk management partner for wealth managers and RIAs.

You'll drive sales management and execution -  
collaborating closely with marketing, alliances, and product teams to ensure our value proposition resonates and our sales motions are repeatable and scalable for these segments and sectors.

What You'll Do

Build and Lead a High-Performing Team

* Recruit, coach, and develop a sales team focused exclusively on wealth management and fin tech prospects to meet or exceed revenue goals consistently.
* Define and monitor key performance metrics to ensure alignment with revenue goals based on our sales methodology
* Foster a collaborative, accountable, and growth-oriented culture where individuals and the team thrive
* Engage with key prospects and customers to support deals and address challenges.

**Drive Market Penetration and Revenue Growth**

* Contribute and execute the go-to-market sales execution for the wealth management/Fin Tech sector, including ensuring that we are reaching ideal customer profiles, messaging, and sales plays
* Engage directly with key prospects and clients to support deals, navigate complex sales cycles, and close strategic opportunities while forecasting performance of the team.
* Lead from the front—this is a player-coach role where your ability to sell alongside your team will be critical

* Work hand-in-hand with marketing and partnership teams to activate channel opportunities and joint go-to-market initiatives given the newness of the market.
* Ensure sales motions are aligned with partnership strategies, driving measurable revenue impact

**Enable Cross-Functional Excellence**

* Serve as a key member of the Revenue Leadership Team, contributing strategic insights across product, marketing, product marketing and customer success
* Partner with Sales Enablement, RevOps, and Solutions Engineering to build scalable systems, processes, and tools
* Advocate for customers and partners in strategic discussions, providing feedback that shapes product roadmap and positioning

What You Bring

**Leadership & Sales Management**

* 6 years of sales management experience, with at least 3+ years leading sales teams in B2B SaaS or financial services
* Exceptional ability to coach, mentor, and inspire both individual contributors and partners to achieve ambitious goals
* Demonstrated success meeting or exceeding sales targets while building programmatic, sustainable growth

**Core Competencies**

* Hunger, humility, and self-awareness: You're driven to win, but lead with emotional intelligence and collaboration
* Sales acumen: You understand complex, multi-stakeholder sales cycles and can navigate them with confidence
* Superb verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to influence executives, clients, and cross-functional partners
* Analytical mindset with a bias toward data-driven decision making

Preferred Experience

* Understanding of the wealth management and FinTech ecosystem—including business models, pain points, and buying behaviors
* Familiarity with risk management, vendor management, cyber security or compliance solutions is a strong plus

title: Vice President, Sales & Business Development - Americas
description:
**Vice President, Sales & Business Development - Americas**

**Desired Work Location:** Cincinnati, OH. Open to well-qualified remote candidates within 20 miles of a StandardAero Component Repair Services facility (Cincinnati OH; Hillsboro OH; Phoenix AZ; Broomfield CO; Miami FL; Ft Myers FL; Palm City FL). Open to well-qualified remote candidates located near key North American Customers (GA, TX, OK, CA, etc.)

**Build an Aviation Career You’re Proud Of**

At StandardAero, we use our ingenuity and know-how to find solutions for the simple to the most complex challenges in Aviation. Together, we get the job done and done well.

**What’s it like at StandardAero**

Collaboration, teamwork, and having each other's backs are the norm here. Our growth in this expanding industry means getting career stability and opportunities to grow. With great resources, an inclusive atmosphere, and a culture based on shared values, we’ll support you in building a solid career with a team you can count on.

As the VP Sales & Business Development Americas in our Component Repair Services (CRS) business, you’ll own leadership of 15- to 25-person team with responsibility for our sales efforts with some of the largest airlines in the world on behalf of a $700M business unit. This team will develop the sales strategy and execute sales opportunities for the Americas region and Customer Programs teams for GE, Aero Alliance, Pratt Whitney, Rolls Royce, and other major customers as defined. The VP Sales & Business Development Americas serves as the face of StandardAero tthis regional market and interfaces with current and prospective customers at all organizational levels to represent the interests of the business with our customers, and to represent the interests of our customers within the business. With tremendous revenue growth opportunity, you will have frequent interaction with our leadership team and customers in your region to provide tailored and creative solutions. Your role will include direct relationship and account responsibilities with key customers, and the leadership of a team of sales professionals.

**What you’ll do as the VP Sales:**

* Lead the sales and customer programs teams in close collaboration with the President CRS, VP Sales & Business Development EMEA, Business Unit VP/GMs, and the Commercial Solutions team; you will develop the regional, account and campaign strategies that will differentiate us in the marketplace and enable us to win strategic campaigns with customers.
* You will serve as the face of StandardAero with our customers, representing our company and contributing towards the StandardAero brand promise as “the trusted service partner”.
* The successful candidate will support the Americas region and will be responsible for forecasting and meeting sales volumes. Other responsibilities will include developing account strategies, leading sales campaigns, negotiating deal terms, supporting customer events, conferences and tradeshows and other duties required to deliver the needs of the business and deliver a superior customer experience.
* You will leverage consultative selling and active listening techniques to understand customer requirements and value drivers. You must be able to negotiate high-revenue, multi-year, complex commercial transactions in line with internal governance process and approvals. You must intuitively understand customer politics and competing interests and be able to anticipate how proposals will be received by customers. You are able to support the Commercial Solutions negotiation team effectively and ensure inclusivity in strategy and bid development.
* You will lead a team of sales & customer programs professionals, providing the mentorship and support that your team needs to be successful in meeting their goals and objectives. You will support your team’s development needs through training, performance management career planning support.
* You will partner with the Commercial Solutions function and VP/GMs of each product line to ensure a smooth transition from contract award to execution and serve as a senior point of escalation for customer in your region.

**What skills you need to be successful:**

* You are a strategic thinker who can approach a sales campaign from multiple angles, identifying innovative ways to increase probability of success and position StandardAero favorably. You can think multiple moves ahead and know how to secure a successful outcome through strategy execution. You can coach and inspire direct and indirect team members to ensure cohesion and alignment to account and campaign strategies.
* Effectively influences and leads teams of peers, direct and indirect reports. Inspires others and helps get the best out of members of any campaign team. Navigates conflict and diffuses tense situations.
* Strong planning, organizational, analytical, leadership, interpersonal, decision making, oral and written communication skills. Strong negotiation, conflict resolution and customer service skills.
* Thorough product knowledge of aerospace Component Repair Services in hot section of the aircraft across all major platforms, including the CFM56 and LEAP or similar.
* Working knowledge of salesforce.com and PowerBI or similar Customer Relationship Management system.
* Minimum 10 years’ customer facing experience required including direct aerospace sales experience.
* Minimum 7 years’ experience leading a regional / global sales team with demonstrated success in developing the team to increased levels of performance outcomes.
* Bachelor’s Degree required; technical / engineering concentration is a differentiator.
* Up to 50% travel required (international & domestic)

**Preferred Characteristics:**

* MBA degree, desired

**We offer benefits that make life better:**

* Comprehensive Healthcare
* 401(k) with 100% company match; up to 5% vested
* Paid Time Off accrual starting on day one
* Bonus opportunities

**What makes a good fit for StandardAero**

We love people who take pride in their work and being collaborative with their team. We work together and support each other. We’re very team oriented too and that is greatly valued. We also believe in getting the job done, whatever it takes and that’s a work-ethic that is often hard to describe. We love that too —it’s what makes us great partners and teammates to each other. We are respectful of each other and who we are, and welcome people from all walks of life and give everyone open access to learn and build skills. We live by the StandardAero brand promise as the trusted service partner to our customers. If this sounds like a great fit for you, we hope you apply and join us.

title: VP of Market Sales
description:
**:**

The VP of Market Sales will be responsible for executing local market-specific sales strategies based on guidance from VP of Regional Sales and working with the Retail sales team and the Business Unit to drive profitable sales. Market Sales VPs will own and manage all local market specific DSD sales activities and maintain close contact with Route Sales Directors. Additionally, the Market Sales VP will constantly look for ways to grow business through interaction with key customer accounts. This person will be responsible for coaching and training RSDs on developing relationships with customers and company Route Sales Representatives. They will also maintain consistent communication with their respective Regional Sales VP to provide perspective on local market-specific successes and areas for improvement.

**Rising to the Challenge: Position Responsibilities**
------------------------------------------------------

* Responsible for executing sales strategies based on guidance from VP of Regional Sales and VP of Division Sales
* Work cross-functionally with the bakeries on report product quality opportunities, late delivery dispatch, and other issues that directly impact the sale department
* Partner with RSDs to execute local sales plans and pursue profitable new business to achieve period and annual goals
* Maintain close contact with VP of Regional Sales and provide updates on performance results and competitor activity to ensure talent and sales plans are aligned to business needs and market demands
* Ensure RSDs work daily with our fundamentals (displays, customer relations, time schedule and callbacks, space and position and distribution)
* Assist RSDs in selling and provide industry standards and best practices advice to successful execution against plan
* Responsible for usage of digital products and the Go Spot Check (GSC) tool for daily and focused missions determined by the digital sales team. Use the tool and reporting to monitor units and dollar sales, profit margin, and stale to drive business
* Provide RSDs with proper guidance, direction, and assistance to achieve profit goals and compliance with all applicable policies and procedures (e.g., customer service requirements, equipment, vehicle, warehouse and other sales-related areas, recruitment, retention, orientation, training, discipline, safety, record keeping, EEO, and other HR-related areas)
* Conduct weekly meetings with RSDs to discuss performance against perfect store execution
* Coach and mentor RSDs in the understanding and use of available information, including the professional presentation of information/knowledge to our customers and employees to blend Flowers goals with customer/employee goals
* Interact with and visit key customer accounts as assigned to build rapport and increase selling opportunities
* Maintain close contact with other Market Sales VPs and Retail Team to stay informed on cross-regional activity and to share key success that could contribute to achieving overall sales growth goals
* Partners with the Human Resources Department to develop a succession plan, employee development, employee engagement and retention.

**Knead to Know: Preferred Qualifications**
-------------------------------------------

* Minimum 5 years of relevant experience in general management or sales
* Past experience as Area Sales Director preferred

**Additional Ingredients: Essential Job Requirements**
------------------------------------------------------

* Bachelor’s degree in Sales or Business Administration preferred

We offer a competitive salary and an excellent total rewards package. Interested job seekers who successfully complete the series of pre-screening questions and who appear to possess the basic qualifications for this position may be contacted for a telephone interview.

**EEO Statement**

Flowers is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Flowers encourages all qualified candidates to apply, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, veteran status, disability status, or people of any other characteristic protected by state or federal law. The job description above outlines the general nature and level of work expected from employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications for this position. Equivalent combination of education, experience, and skills may supplement above minimum job requirements.

If you need assistance with submitting your resume due to a medical condition or disability, please send an e-mail to Matthew West at Matthew.West@flocorp.com or (1) 279 7829599.

title: VP, Consumer Sales
description:
**Position Summary**

The ***VP Consumer Sales*** will be responsible for achieving annual sales, margin and revenue objectives through the leadership and management of the sales team. In addition to leading the growth of the business, the VP Consumer Sales will develop and implement best in class performance metrics, sales processes, and collaborate on delivering compensation and incentive programs that drive performance.

This leader must be able to think strategically but also roll up their sleeves and get engaged at the tactical sales level. It is critical that this individual is a proven leader who can inspire, motivate, and develop others. This leader must be able to elevate the sales team to outstanding levels of performance, driving enhancement of the overall effectiveness, skill level, and professionalism of the sales team. The incumbent will collaborate with other key members of the executive leadership team to drive a deeper understanding of the customer and improve the ability to maximize sales and profits.

**This position requires to be working in office, 3 days minimum per week from our Bala Cynwyd, PA office.**

**Role Responsibilities**

* Develop and execute a comprehensive sales strategy that drives revenue growth and customer satisfaction.
* Develop and implement “best in class” sales techniques, including processes, tools, and performance measures.
* Partner and collaborate across all store support center teams to align sales goals with organizational initiatives.
* Develop sales forecasts, goals and corresponding initiatives based upon overall strategy, market conditions and operational capabilities.
* Lead and mentor a team of regional leaders, cultivating and fostering high performing teams, and a highly engaged workforce.
* Manage sales budgets, forecasts, and profitability targets. Own key performance metrics and deliver consistent growth.
* Provide regular updates to senior leadership regarding sales activities to ensure they are well informed of the relevant issues.
* Monitor market trends, competitive activity, and customer needs to inform strategic decision making and positioning

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, or related field (MBA preferred).
* 10+ years of progressive experience in sales leadership roles, with at least 5 years in retail, service-based industry.
* Proven strength in leading multi-unit retail/adjacent businesses of scale, preferably with roots in brick & mortar and omnichannel operations.
* Evidence of identifying new growth channels, market opportunities, and monetization of existing assets in new ways.
* Track record of attracting, developing and retaining talent; creates a performance culture and drives a balance between sales and culture.
* Proven ability to create and drive successful go-to-market strategy, prioritize market opportunities, create value-based customer solutions.

**Physical Demands/Work Environment**

* Repetitive movement of hands and fingers, typing or writing.
* Regular standing and walking.
* Reach with hands and arms.
* Travel up to 5% of the time.
* Talk and hear.
* Ability to work under tight time constraints, handle sensitive data and multi-task so that deadlines can be met.
* Highly organized and able to prioritize and manage time efficiently with the ability to handle stress in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment.

The physical demands described above are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

**Benefits**

* Medical, dental, and vision benefits
* Life insurance
* Short Term Disability
* Supplemental benefits
* 401(k) with company match
* PTO and holiday pay
* On-demand pay partner (DailyPay)
* Reduced benefits available for part-time team members

*Pep Boys is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.*

#LI-AE1

title: VP, Commercial
description:
**This position requires to be working in office, 3 days per week from our Bala Cynwyd, PA office.**

**Position Overview**

The Vice President, Commercial is a senior leadership role accountable for driving revenue growth, expanding market share, and increasing profitability within the Commercial Business segment. This role leads national and regional sales teams, cultivates strategic relationships with key commercial clients, and ensures the alignment of sales initiatives with broader company objectives. The VP will champion the development and execution of innovative strategies, high-impact channel development, and best-in-class performance metrics, while fostering strong cross-functional collaboration across the organization.

**Duties & Responsibilities**

* Financial Oversight: The VP will have direct responsibility for the P&L of the Commercial Business, accountable for generating revenue, while managing costs and ensuring overall financial success, including identifying levers for improvements.

* Strategic Decision Making: The VP will be responsible for elevated strategic decision-making. They will be required to have a deeper understanding and respond more intentionally to market trends, competitor actions, customer needs, and making decisions that balance sales growth with profitability.

* Cross Functional Collaboration: The VP will collaborate with Consumer Sales, Service Quality, Merchandising, Marketing, Operations, Supply Chain, and other departments to drive a deeper understanding of the customer, and development of the business model to maximize sales and profit.

* Long-Term Planning: The VP will own the strategic direction of the Commercial Business. This requires more skill in long-term business planning and forecasting, considering not just Commercial Sales projections but other metrics and how they align with overall Pep-Boys business profitability and growth objections.

* Cultivate and foster an environment of high performance, using performance management methodologies, employee development, career progression and rewards and recognition.

**Education and Experience**

* Bachelor's Degree in a related field required. Master's Degree preferred.
* 10+ years of progressive sales leadership experience in the automotive aftermarket, fleet services or related industry.
* 8 - 10 years of supervisory experience.
* Proven track record of managing national accounts and driving multimillion-dollar fleet growth.
* Strong analytical, communication, and negotiation skills.
* Strong leadership presence and ability to influence cross-functionally

**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**

* Knowledge of sales forecasting methods and the ability to develop goals and initiatives aligned with overall strategy, market conditions, and operational capabilities
* Skill in overseeing the development and implementation of sales management technologies, training, and employee development programs
* Ability to drive successful sales execution across a diverse customer base, including national accounts, regional chains, and fragmented market.

**Physical Demands/Work Environment**

* Repetitive movement of hands and fingers, typing or writing.
* Regular standing and walking.
* Reach with hands and arms.
* Travel up to 5% of the time.
* Talk and hear.
* Ability to work under tight time constraints, handle sensitive data and multi-task so that deadlines can be met.
* Highly organized and able to prioritize and manage time efficiently with the ability to handle stress in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment.

The physical demands described above are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

**Benefits**

* Medical, dental, and vision benefits
* Life insurance
* Short Term Disability
* Supplemental benefits
* 401(k) with company match
* PTO and holiday pay
* On-demand pay partner (DailyPay)
* Reduced benefits available for part-time team members

*Pep Boys is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.*

title: BPO VP of Sales - USA
description:
At our company, we believe in business as a force for good — and that starts with helping Kiwi companies work smarter, grow faster, and compete globally.

We’re on a mission to partner with USA's most forward-thinking organisations — giving them the tools, talent, and operational power to scale through exceptional BPO solutions.

As our **Vice President of Sales in USA**, you won’t just be driving revenue — you’ll be helping businesses across Aotearoa thrive in a fast-changing world. You’ll lead with purpose, build trust, and deliver meaningful impact.

**Why This Role Matters**

USA is a country built on ingenuity, resilience, and heart. We’re looking for a sales leader who reflects those values — someone who can lead the charge, build deep relationships, and be the face of our brand in-market.

You’ll be tasked with building a $5M+ revenue engine, grounded in long-term client partnerships and measurable outcomes.

This role is for a **builder**, a **doer**, and a **believer in better**.

**What You’ll Do**

* Lead our sales strategy and execution across USA — with autonomy and ambition.
* Cultivate strong relationships with enterprise and mid-sized businesses across key sectors.
* Collaborate closely with internal teams to deliver tailored, high-impact BPO solutions.
* Represent the company at local business forums, industry events, and strategic roundtables.
* Help shape and grow our presence in NZ — and eventually build a high-performing sales team.

**Who You Are**

* A proven sales leader with 8+ years of BPO or outsourcing sales experience.
* Known for building trusted relationships and closing complex, high-value deals.
* Commercially sharp, values-led, and deeply tuned into the Kiwi business landscape.
* A self-starter with entrepreneurial energy — confident navigating ambiguity and scaling success.
* A natural communicator and team player, with a genuine passion for helping businesses thrive.

**Bonus Points If…**

* You’ve launched or scaled a new market or business unit in NZ or across APAC.
* You bring deep networks in key sectors like healthcare, telco, finance, or logistics.
* You understand the cultural and operational nuances of delivering global services locally.

**What You’ll Love**

* A purpose-driven culture rooted in trust, innovation, and results.
* A competitive compensation package built to reward growth and grit.
* Autonomy to lead your market — and the support of a high-calibre global team.
* The opportunity to build something meaningful, right here in Aotearoa.

**If you’re ready to lead with purpose and help shape the future of work in USA — we’d love to hear from you.**

Send your resume or LinkedIn profile to Shilpa.chinnappa@contactpoint360.com

ALSO, top preferences are given to candidates who will complete the following interview prerequisite by completing the first step of the interview via this Form: https://contactpoint360.typeform.com/salesdirector

Subject: BPO VP of Sales - USA – [Your Name]

**About ContactPoint360**

If you want to be the next CEO… we’re not joking.

Our CEO started on the phones as a customer service agent. Around here, nothing is impossible when you lead with curiosity, kindness, and the right mindset.

ContactPoint360 is a Canadian, people-first company with 5,000 incredible humans across 12 countries. We’re proud that 70% of our leaders grew from within, proof that growth isn’t just a promise, it’s our culture. From day one, you’ll have a clear career path, real support, and a team that believes in your potential before you even see it yourself. We care about people, and we’re big believers in building futures, not just filling roles.

If you’re hungry, if you care, if you want to build a real career instead of just collecting a paycheck, you’re in the right place. We’ll give you the tools, the mentorship, and the path from day one. This is where potential turns into progression. Welcome home.

**Our Purpose:**

Our goal is to create the best human experience, ensure the highest client satisfaction, and transform clients’ customers into loyal advocates for life.

Check out our YouTube video:https://youtu.be/AsPjX-5uyQQ

title: Vice President of Sales – New Logos
description:
We’re looking for an entrepreneurial **Vice President of Sales – New Logos** to join our journey. This is not just a sales role—it’s an opportunity to build transformative relationships with some of the world’s most forward-thinking brands. If you’re driven by purpose, energized by possibility, and eager to bring new customers into the fold, let’s talk.

**What You’ll Be Doing**

1. **Own the Future of Sales**

* Drive ContactPoint360’s growth by securing new logos in key verticals like transportation, logistics, retail, Health, Financial, Government, Telecom, Retail, and e-commerce.
* Be the architect of high-impact deals, shaping solutions that empower clients and elevate their businesses.
* Lead the sales cycle from vision to execution—cultivating leads, developing strategies, and closing multimillion-dollar partnerships.

2. **Build Deep, Meaningful Relationships**

* Become a trusted advisor to C-suite executives, understanding their biggest challenges and delivering solutions that drive results.
* Leverage your network of decision-makers and industry leaders to create a pipeline of high-value opportunities.
* Partner with internal teams to ensure seamless handoffs and exceptional client onboarding experiences.

3. **Embody Innovation and Excellence**

* Push boundaries with creative approaches to selling BPO services.
* Stay ahead of market trends and emerging technologies, positioning ContactPoint360 as the clear choice for transformative customer experience solutions.
* Bring bold ideas and fresh energy to the table daily.

4. **Inspire Success and Drive Impact**

* Set ambitious sales targets and surpass them.
* Inspire your team and colleagues with your passion, work ethic, and commitment to excellence.
* Represent ContactPoint360 at industry events, spreading the word about our mission to redefine what’s possible in customer experience.

**What Makes You a Perfect Fit**

* **A Proven Trailblazer:**
* 10+ years of BPO sales experience, with a stellar record of securing new clients and closing large, transformative deals.
* Deep knowledge of customer experience, digital transformation, and back-office services.
* **A Natural Connector:**
* You thrive on building relationships and have a network that opens doors to industry leaders and decision-makers.
* Exceptional communicator and negotiator who can win trust and inspire action.
* **A Visionary with Grit:**
* You’re forward-thinking, strategic, and obsessed with finding impactful solutions.
* Resilient and resourceful, you embrace challenges and transform them into opportunities.
* **A Team Player Who Drives Results:**
* Collaborative and innovative, you love working with cross-functional teams to bring bold ideas to life.
* Data-driven with a focus on measurable results, you consistently exceed expectations.

**Why Join ContactPoint360?**

At ContactPoint360, we believe the future is built on partnerships. Joining our team means becoming part of a culture defined by bold thinking, relentless innovation, and deep human connection.

* Be part of a high-growth, global company transforming customer experience for the world’s most innovative brands.
* Work with some of the brightest minds in the industry, supported by cutting-edge tools and resources.
* Earn a competitive compensation package with performance-driven incentives that reward excellence.
* Have a voice. Bring your ideas, and we’ll give you the platform to make them happen.

**Ready to Build Something Extraordinary?**

If you’re ready to create transformative partnerships and leave your mark on the future of customer experience, we want to hear from you. Submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your passion for sales and how you’ve driven impact in previous roles to our Talent Acquisition Manager: shilpa.chinnappa@contactpoint360.com.

**Dream big. Innovate bigger. Welcome to ContactPoint360.**

title: Vice President, Institutional Sales
description:
**About the Firm**

FM Global Markets Inc. is a U.S. FINRA-registered broker-dealer focused on institutional capital raising, private placements, and distribution for early-stage and growth-stage companies. The firm works closely with its Canadian licensed affiliate FMI Securities Inc. and broader network to connect issuers with family offices, funds, and high-net-worth investors across North America and internationally. FM Global Markets is part of an affiliated group of capital markets and advisory firms, FMI Capital Partners Inc. (www.fmicap.com).

**Role Overview**

FM Global Markets Inc. is seeking a senior-level Institutional Sales & Securities Distribution professional to expand and manage relationships with family offices, institutional funds, and high-net-worth investors. This is a predominantly predominantly a sales role focused on investor coverage, relationship management, and execution support.

The successful candidate will have a base of established investor relationships to support capital raises, and work alongside deal teams to help execute financings for the firm's early-stage and growth-stage private and public company clients.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Build, expand, and manage relationships with family offices, institutional funds, and high-net-worth investors.
* Drive investor engagement and distribution for private placements and other capital raising transactions.
* Support transaction execution by coordinating investor outreach, feedback, and allocation processes.
* Assist issuer clients by representing them in investor meetings, introductions, and capital markets discussions.
* Support and participate in management roadshows, investor calls, and conferences.
* Maintain active coverage of assigned investor accounts and develop long-term, trust-based relationships.
* Collaborate with internal teams across the affiliated group to align investor demand with transaction opportunities.
* Track investor interest, feedback, and commitments throughout the lifecycle of a financing.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, or a related field; MBA and/or CFA designation preferred.
* Minimum 5 years of experience in investment banking, private equity, capital markets, or institutional sales.
* Established network of funds, family offices, and institutional / accredited investors.
* Demonstrated ability to raise capital or support successful execution of private or public financings.
* Strong interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills.
* Entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to operate effectively in a fast-moving environment.
* High standards of integrity, judgment, and professionalism.

**Licensing Requirements**

* FINRA Series 7 and Series 63 required.
* Willingness and eligibility to obtain Canadian securities licensing within a reasonable period following commencement of employment.

**Compensation**

* Competitive base salary.
* Performance-based variable compensation tied to closed transactions and originated investments.

**Why Join FM Global Markets**

* Senior role with meaningful autonomy over investor relationships.
* Access to a robust and quickly growing cross-border deal pipeline through an integrated U.S.–Canada platform.
* Opportunity to work with exciting growth-stage companies across multiple sectors.
* Entrepreneurial environment with direct impact on revenue and platform growth.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $120,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Miami, FL 33131

title: Vice President, Retail Sales
description:
**Role: Vice President, Retail Sales**

**Location: Sterling, VA, 20163 (Hybrid)**

**Industry: Food Manufacturing / Premium Prepared Foods**

**Employment Type: Full-Time**

**Seniority: Executive Leadership**

  

**About the Role (Client Name Hidden)**

We are supporting a leading U.S. food manufacturing company specializing in premium sous vide and prepared foods.

They are seeking a Vice President, Retail Sales to lead national retail expansion and drive substantial growth across major grocery, mass, and club channels.

This is a high-impact executive role responsible for national retail strategy, revenue growth, and leadership of the retail sales organization.

  

**Key Responsibilities**

* Lead and execute a national retail sales strategy for premium sous vide and prepared food products.
* Build, mentor, and lead a high-performing sales organization (regional directors, account managers, brokers).
* Manage executive relationships with major national retailers (Whole Foods, Kroger, Costco, Target, Publix, Albertsons, etc.).
* Drive product placement, category expansion, promotions, and joint business planning.
* Lead customer negotiations, trade spend optimization, and pricing strategy.
* Partner with Marketing & Culinary teams to align innovation with consumer trends and retailer needs.
* Collaborate with Operations & Supply Chain on demand planning, forecasting, and fulfillment.
* Monitor competitive activity and market trends to identify growth opportunities.
* Represent the brand at major industry events, trade shows, and food innovation forums.

**Required Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Sales, or related field (MBA preferred).
* 10+ years of senior sales leadership experience within food manufacturing.
* Strong background in selling to national retail channels: Grocery, Mass, Club, Natural, and Specialty.

**Proven success in:**

* Launching products into retail.
* Scaling retail programs nationally.
* Leading and motivating large sales teams.
* Managing P&L, trade spend, and strategic negotiations.
* Experience with premium food, refrigerated items, or prepared food categories (highly preferred).
* Ability to travel up to 50%.

**Preferred Experience**

* Knowledge of sous vide, premium prepared foods, or high-end culinary product categories.
* Experience working closely with culinary or R&D teams.
* Strong understanding of natural versus conventional retail strategies.

**Ideal Candidate Profile**

* **Please prioritize candidates who:**
* Bring strong national retail relationships (Whole Foods, Kroger, Costco, etc.)
* Have premium food / refrigerated CPG sales experience.
* Can demonstrate proven revenue growth in previous roles.
* Have executive-level negotiation and leadership skills.

title: Vice President of Ticket Sales
description:
Title: Vice President of Ticket Sales  
Reports To: President  
  
Job Summary/General Description:  
The Vice President of Ticket Sales is responsible for leading the Club’s full ticketing revenue strategy, including Full  
Season Equivalents, Groups, Premium Seating, and Renewals. This role owns long-term revenue planning, product  
innovation, pipeline strategy, pricing architecture, and departmental culture. The VP leads a unified sales & service  
organization, drives adoption of sales technology, and partners cross-functionally to maximize revenue and fan  
experience.  
  
Key Responsibilities:  

* Strategic Leadership & Revenue Ownership
* Build and execute the Club’s annual ticketing revenue plan across all product lines.
* Lead long-term pricing, packaging, and product strategy.
* Oversee forecasting, budgeting, revenue tracking and reporting.
* Monitor industry trends and emerging technologies to evolve the product portfolio.
* Team Leadership & Culture
* Lead, mentor, and develop the unified Ticket Sales & Service team.
* Oversee recruitment, training programs, and staff performance management.
* Build a positive, high-accountability sales culture grounded in development and customer experience.
* Sales Infrastructure & Technology
* Oversee CRM strategy, data hygiene, lead scoring, and automation.
* Evaluate and prioritize investments in enabling technologies.
* Establish standards around inventory management, contract accuracy, discounting, and payment structures.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration
* Work inter-departmentally to align promotions, product strategy, and revenue opportunities.
* Represent the department internally and externally with executive-level communication.
* Other Duties
* Serve as a key member of the senior leadership team.
* Perform additional responsibilities as assigned.

  
Minimum Qualifications:  

* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Sports Management, or related field.
* 7+ years of ticket sales management experience with a professional sports team.
* Demonstrated success leading high-performing sales teams and delivering revenue growth.
* Strong knowledge of CRM and ticketing platforms.
* Excellent communication, presentation, and leadership skills.
* Ability to work non-traditional hours including evenings, weekends, and event days.

title: Area Vice President, Ocular Sales West
description:
**Position Summary**

The Area Vice President, Ocular Sales- West will be responsible for delivering on revenue metrics, talent management, RSD (Regional Sales Directors) and sales rep development, adhere to P&L, and align themselves to all CORE BioTissue values. The individual will be ethical and ensure the highest integrity in all BioTissue interactions.

**Essential Duties & Responsibilities**

* Effectively communicate strategy, goals, and progress
* Effectively provide guidance, support, training, and performance management as necessary
* Communicate effectively with all internal/external stakeholders and collaborate and work effectively across all areas of the business including.
* Provide training for new employees or to existing employees as needed.
* Carries out all supervisory responsibilities in a fair, consistent, and respectful manner and in accordance with the organization’s CORE values
* Increase the Company’s territory coverage and **network, engage, and participate with industry organizations**.
* Ability to develop professional relationships with Distributors, Contractors, and C-communities to facilitate the introduction of our products, values, and future.
* A broad set of leadership competencies that include strong communication and change management skills, ability to drive business insights, ability to collaborate cross functionally, and effective planning and execution skills.
* Ability to effectively manage multiple projects, requirements and competing demands in a deadline driven environment.

**Education/Experience**

* Extensive sales leadership experience (8+ years) in the med tech industry with a proven track record of leading salespeople to revenue achievements, developing individuals, and performance management
* Extensive knowledge on contract negotiations, familiarity with GPO an IDN account
* Bachelor s degree required; Masters/MBA degree preferred

**Skills & Abilities**

Essential Duty Definition:

* **Ability to adapt** – Because what worked last year might not work again this year, an AVP of Sales must apply lessons learned from past experiences to achieve new results. An AVP of Sales needs to keep track of the latest trends and technology and apply them to current situations.
* **Business command** – Knowing the numbers and offering insights is crucial for an AVP of Sales since doing so strategically gives an impression of credibility, competence, and assurance.
* **Possess an eye for talent** – Hiring the best sales leaders is crucial since it is one of the most expensive mistakes a business can make to give someone a salary who cannot perform at the required level.
* **Thinks strategically** – Business and sales are constantly evolving, and the AVP of Sales needs to be aware of this. They must plan their strategy based on how they wish to increase their sales.
* **Build strong relationships** – The AVP of Sales must nurture a strong connection with the sales department, the marketing department, the C-suite executives, and the clients. They should know that building and maintaining customer relationships is essential in the med tech sector. The top AVPs of Sales act as relationship-building role models for the rest of the sales organization, and they understand the importance of soft skills
* **Possess Emotional Intelligence** – A top area vice president of sales possesses considerable emotional intelligence and works to nurture the same among everyone in the sales organization. Must have fundamental skills and traits such as self-awareness and control, self-motivation, resilience, empathy, active listening, intellectual curiosity, and stress management.

title: VP, Sales
description:
Description:

**POSITION SUMMARY**

The Vice President of Sales, Hospitals & Health Systems is a senior leadership role responsible for setting and executing the sales vision and strategy to drive growth within the provider healthcare market. This individual will oversee a national team dedicated to selling cybersecurity, risk management, and compliance solutions to hospitals, integrated delivery networks (IDNs), academic medical centers, and large healthcare systems.
  
  
This role requires deep understanding of the healthcare regulatory landscape, including HIPAA, 405d, HITECH and other cybersecurity-related initiatives impacting patient data protection and risk mitigation. The VP will collaborate with product, marketing, and service delivery teams to tailor solutions that meet the evolving needs of hospital executives, including CIOs, CISOs, CMIOs, and compliance officers.

**KEY** **RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Develop and execute the strategic vision and business plan for the hospitals and health systems segment, focusing on driving growth, expanding market share, and enhancing customer satisfaction within IDNs.
* Cultivate and strengthen long-term relationships with senior executives, including C-level leaders and decision-makers in hospitals and health systems, ensuring alignment of business objectives and fostering collaboration.
* Work with internal teams (product, marketing, sales, and operations) to tailor solutions that address the specific needs of IDNs, including clinical integration, patient care, data interoperability, and cost management.
* Lead business development and sales efforts targeting hospitals, health systems, and IDNs, identifying opportunities for growth and driving new revenue streams through innovative solutions and services.
* Oversee the implementation of solutions that improve operational performance, clinical outcomes, and cost efficiencies within IDNs. Ensure that the company's offerings align with industry standards, regulatory requirements, and best practices.
* Direct and manage contract negotiations with large health systems and IDNs, ensuring favorable terms, compliance, and mutual benefit.
* Partner with sales, marketing, client success, and product development teams to ensure that offerings are aligned with market needs, and to ensure successful product deployment and ongoing customer engagement.
* Represent the company at industry events, conferences, and networking opportunities, positioning the organization as a thought leader in the IDN and healthcare sectors.
* Lead the financial management of the hospitals and health systems portfolio, ensuring the achievement of revenue, profitability, and operational goals. Provide regular updates and reports to senior leadership on performance metrics and market conditions.
* Ensure all strategies and engagements comply with healthcare regulations, industry standards (e.g., HIPAA, HITECH), and corporate governance policies.
* Perform other duties within the scope of the role as assigned.

Requirements:

**QUALIFICATIONS &** **EXPERIENCE**

* 10+ years of experience in B2B sales, with a minimum of 5–7 years in healthcare sales leadership roles.
* Deep understanding of the hospital/provider market, especially cybersecurity and compliance needs of large health systems.
* Proven success selling into healthcare C-suite audiences, including CIOs, CISOs, and compliance leaders.
* Experience managing multi-million-dollar sales quotas and scaling high-performance teams.
* Track record of closing complex, consultative deals in regulated industries.
* Familiarity with HIPAA, HITECH, NIST CSF, HICP, and other healthcare-specific risk frameworks.

**EDUCATION & CERTIFICATIONS**

* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Healthcare Administration, Cybersecurity, or related field; MBA or advanced degree preferred.
* Relevant certifications (e.g., CISM, CISSP, PMP) are a plus.

**LEADERSHIP ATTRIBUTES**

* Strategic and analytical thinker with strong execution focus.
* Inspirational leader and coach who builds high-performance teams and future leaders.
* Strong interpersonal and executive communication skills.
* Passionate about improving healthcare through innovation and trusted partnerships.
* High integrity and alignment with core company values: customer success, collaboration, accountability, and excellence.

**PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT EXPECTATIONS**

* Stay current on healthcare cybersecurity trends, federal and state regulations, and evolving hospital needs.
* Develop strong networks within healthcare associations, consortiums, and executive forums.
* Represent the company as a trusted advisor and thought leader in the provider space.
* Promote a culture of continuous learning and adaptability within the sales organization.
